summary: Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee who resigned on October 4, 1961. Prior to his resignation, he underwent a cover debriefing to maintain secrecy about his employment and travel history. In 1963, his military cover backstop was cancelled, requiring the return of all military documentation. By 1968, he was an Operations Officer and a request was made for a Permanent Change of Station (PCS) overseas evaluation to reassign him from Managua, Nicaragua, to JMCOBRA. His personnel file includes records of promotions, reassignments, and a notice of an official disability claim file.
significance: The documents indicate that Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee involved in operations and overseas assignments. While the documents do not explicitly link him to the JFK assassination, his role as an Operations Officer and his association with JMCOBRA, a code name often associated with covert operations, suggest a potential indirect connection to events or individuals related to the assassination. Further investigation would be required to determine any direct involvement.
